intro: Matelea atrostellata, commonly known as the black starmatelea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant produces striking, showy flowers that are typically red or orange with a dark center, attracting various pollinators. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open woodlands. The leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture, while the stems are often branched and covered in fine hairs.
